conclusion: Analyze forces on the wire in the magnetic field and their effect on spring scales.
Magnetic force on wire is given by F = I L B sin(theta).
Since theta = 90 degrees, sin(90) = 1, so F = I L B.
Direction of force is downward using right-hand rule.
Initial condition: wire experiences downward force F = I L B.
Each scale reads F1 = (I L B) / 2.
Reversed current condition: force becomes F' = 2I L B.
Each scale reads F2 = I L B.
Relate readings to find B: F2 = 2F1.
Substitute expressions for F1 and F2: I L B = 2((I L B) / 2).
Rearrange equation for F1 to find B: B = (2F1) / (I L).
